agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including limited financial assistance.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for short-term situations as a stop-gap measure for people in need. Funding for bills will be considered for a broad range of needs, including, but limited to medical, education, employment, and housing expenses. Assistance is not immediate. Requests take a week to process.
site_details: Calling first is ideal, but is not required. -- Answer interview questions and provide any requested documentation.
site_eligibility: Living in Huntington County -- Have proof of need

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides transitional sober living for men that is focused on 12-step programming.
service_description: Offers an individualized experience for men seeking recovery from alcohol and/or drug addiction, based on a 12-step philosophy of daily living.. Provides each resident a safe and supportive environment creating the opportunity for rehabilitation and lifelong sobriety.. The program duration is 6 to 18 months.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call, text, or chat on web page. -- Applications can take place over the phone.
site_eligibility: Men -- Recovering from a substance abuse disorder -- Age 18 or older -- Not a sex offender or violent offender

agency_desc: Provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for residents. Circulates books, eBooks, periodicals, audio books, CDs, DVDs, and Blu-rays. Provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer, internet, fax, photocopy, and meeting room space.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a free library card: Living in Roanoke city limits or own real or personal property within Roanoke Public Library district

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food and meat to persons in need. Emergency appointments may be made after an assessment. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in; register with names/ages of all family members, contact number and address.
site_eligibility: Living in Huntington County and surround counties

agency_name: TURNPOINTE COMMUNITY CHURCH OF THE BRETHREN
agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
site_name: TURNPOINTE COMMUNITY CHURCH OF THE BRETHREN
service_description: Provides nonperishable food and frozen meat to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in; use the entrance (without a canopy) on lower level, not the main entrance.
site_eligibility: Living within the boundaries: N- County Road 1100 North;  S- County Road 500 South; E- County Road 100 West; W- Meridian Road in Markle

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.

service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency services; call or visit website for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.

agency_name: AGING AND IN-HOME SERVICES OF NORTHEAST INDIANA - MEAL SITES
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides nutrition services to older adults and disabled individuals.
service_description: Offers a hot, nutritious lunch each weekday for area seniors. One day advance notice required.
site_details: Call at least 24 hours in advance to make a reservation.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older and their spouses -- Persons with physical disabilities

agency_desc: Rural electric company that provides electric service for customers within its service area.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in parts of Allen, Huntington, Wabash, and Wells counties, and portions of Adams, Grant, and Whitely counties.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is available at this location.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Huntington County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Huntington County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Huntington County, which is then used to assess taxes.Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Huntington County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees court cases involving Huntington County minors, including petitions for emancipation, children in need of services (CHINS), and minors accused of delinquency or status offenses.
site_details: By court order; parents cannot self-refer children to juvenile court.
site_eligibility: Age 17 or under

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including family cases, in Huntington County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor’s office, private attorneys, or individuals representing themselves.  For juror information, contact the corresponding court.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the  Huntington County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Huntington County Circuit and Superior Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Huntington County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Huntington County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a diaper bank.
service_description: Provides a week's worth of diapers and wipes to eligible families. Other baby supplies such as formula, food, and diaper bags may also be available. Clients apply through Love Inc. one week in advance, prior to picking up items. Families may return for recurring visits up to twice per month. Limited service area.
site_details: Call Love Inc. to complete phone assessment. -- Staff will arrange for clients to pick up items.
site_schedule: Intake: Mon-Thurs 9:30am-4pm; Fri 9:30am-noon -- Distribution: Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 11am-noon and 5pm-6pm
site_eligibility: In need of assistance (based on assessment)

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Huntington County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Huntington County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Huntington County)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support and resources to individuals in recovery from substance abuse.
service_description: Provides support, referrals, and resources to individuals in recovery from substance abuse.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides adult advocacy services to victims of sexual assault and domestic violence.
service_description: Provides advocacy services for adult survivors of domestic violence and/or sexual assault. Services include: trauma informed crisis response, safety planning, community resources, referrals for mental health services, advocacy, coordination of services, help navigating the legal system, and accompaniment to medial and court appointments. For safety reasons, services can be given completely anonymously if needed.
site_details: Call or text 260-355-9082 to set up an appointment with a family advocate.
site_eligibility: Living in Huntington County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides adult advocacy services to victims of sexual assault and domestic violence.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Varies; voicemail available daily 24 hours - By appointment only
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Huntington County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards, such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

site_eligibility: Living in withiin the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible patients receiving treatment from this center.

site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon and Wed 8am-6pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-8pm; Fri 8am-5pm

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.

site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Huntington County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Huntington County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Huntington County. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and healthy living programs for all ages.
service_description: Offers access to social opportunities and healthy living programs for all ages, including child care, pre-school, youth and adult sports, weight-lifting, aerobics, and swimming lessons. Members pay dues for open access to the fitness center, fitness classes, and pool/sauna and receive discounted rates for special programs. Nonmembers pay fixed fees for classes.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to join or register for specific programs. Call for more information.
site_schedule: Regular Hours: Mon-Fri 5am-9pm; Sat 7am-5pm; Sun noon-5pm Summer Hours (Memorial Day-Labor Day):  Mon-Fri 5am-9pm; Sat 7am-3pm; Sun noon-3pm
site_eligibility: Open; membership not required for most programs, but members do receive discounts on fees.

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization that provides various resources to help meet basic living resources to people in need.
service_description: Offers vouchers for free clothing and household goods (such as bedding or kitchenware) to eligible individuals and families. The vouchers may be redeemed at the Covered With Love resale shop. Clothing assistance is limited to three outfits per person. site_details: To receive vouchers: Call the office for a phone assessment or to schedule an appointment. -- To use vouchers: Walk in to the store.
site_eligibility: Living in Huntington County -- In need of clothing or household items (based on assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides charitable outreach programs to those in need.
service_description: Provides prenatal and early childhood support through a program that combines parenting education, economic self-sufficiency planning, and health and social services for low-income families. site_details: Call or send an email for enrollment information.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and families with children up to age 3 -- Household income at or below 100% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veterans, surviving spouses or children of a veteran.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members
